Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.

P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020, children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year, and for children who attend a Provision 2 School. Therefore, all students who attend Borden County ISD are eligible for the P-EBT food benefit. For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT

If you have questions concerning this matter, you may contact Ross D. Sharp, County Judge at (806) 756-4391, 117 E. Wasson Avenue, Gail, Texas 79738.

Latham will be attending Texas Tech University where he will be pursuing a degree in natural resource management.

Born 6 weeks early, screaming and throwing up, life with Will Yarbro has never been boring. He started school at Borden County in kindergarten and was involved in the two-time state championship football team, served as captain his senior year, state runner-up baseball team, and state qualifying basketball team. In addition to sports, Will was voted Homecoming King his senior year and began an upstart business of providing mobile cell phone charging to his teammates while on out of town games. Will's favorite memory was all the many miles spent on buses with his teammates. Will's future plans include attending South Plains College to pursue a career in electrical lineman.

BCISD is proud to introduce our 2020 BORDEN COUNTY SENIOR ❤️👩‍🎓 Maegen Bland 👩‍🎓💙

Maegen Brenae Bland is the 17 year old daughter of Mike and Tammy Bland of Post, Texas. She is a senior at Borden County and proud to be one of the original five graduates that has attended Borden County all thirteen years, K-12. She has been actively involved in basketball, FFA (radio and wool judging), and stockshows exhibiting both sheep and goats throughout her career. Her most recent honor was being selected as Breed Champion Fine Wool Cross in her last outing as a Junior Exhibitor.
Maegen plans to attend Angelo State University in August 2020, living in the dorms and majoring in Elementary Education with an interest in educating the younger generation.
Maegen enjoys spending her free time with her dogs, Xander and Xaiden, her friends and her family (In that order). She hopes to one day return to small town Texas to start her career in Education.

We are proud to introduce our 2020 BORDEN COUNTY SENIOR ❤️ 👨‍🎓 Colbin Briley 👨‍🎓💙

Colbin has always loved the farm. Some people think he has farming in his blood. Colbin has been helping his father on the family farm since he was able to see over the steering wheel. His future plans include attending Angelo State University and majoring in animal science. His ultimate dream is coming back to Borden County to be a farmer. Colbin has been showing steers since the third grade. During his showing career he has placed steers at the Fort Worth stock show, Houston stock show, and San Antonio stock show. One highlight in his showing career was placing first at the State Fair of Texas with his Simmental steer Adam. He is an active member in FFA, and currently he is the Borden County FFA Vice-president. He participated in football and track during junior high. He also was on the junior varsity football team when he was a freshman.
